Class InputReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • InputReader
  • public class InputReader
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to read input from the console and from the different files given as examples to store the rules of the language This class creates two instances of the Scanner, one of them will read the users input from console and the other reads the contents of the example files.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      InputReader()
      When an instance of Input Reader is created first it waits for the user's input to indicate from which example file should the parser read to create the language.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getMaxDepth()
      This method asks for the maximum depth that the created tree must have.
      java.lang.String[] getNonTerminalSymbols()
      This method reads the line of the input file that contains the Non terminal Symbols and returns an array of those symbols
      java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,​java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String>> getProductions()
      This method reads all the remaining lines of the example which contain the productions of the language and represents them as a Hashtable of productions
      java.lang.String getStartSymbol()
      This method reads the line of the input file that contains the Start Symbol of the Tree
      java.lang.String getString()
      This method reads from the console a String that should be validated by the parser
      java.lang.String[] getTerminalSymbols()
      This method reads the line of the input file that contains the list of Terminal Symbols

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputReader

        public InputReader()
            throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        When an instance of Input Reader is created first it waits for the user's input to indicate from which example file should the parser read to create the language.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if for some reason one of the four examples files are missing from the test directory

    • Method Detail

      • getNonTerminalSymbols

        public java.lang.String[] getNonTerminalSymbols()
        This method reads the line of the input file that contains the Non terminal Symbols and returns an array of those symbols
        Returns:
        an array of the non terminal symbols as Strings

      • getTerminalSymbols

        public java.lang.String[] getTerminalSymbols()
        This method reads the line of the input file that contains the list of Terminal Symbols
        Returns:
        an array of the terminal symbols as Strings

      • getStartSymbol

        public java.lang.String getStartSymbol()
        This method reads the line of the input file that contains the Start Symbol of the Tree
        Returns:
        a String representation of the Start Symbol

      • getProductions

        public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,​java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String>> getProductions()
        This method reads all the remaining lines of the example which contain the productions of the language and represents them as a Hashtable of productions
        Returns:
        a representacion of the productions of the language where the key String is a Non-terminal symbol which maps to a LinkedList containing all the productions of that symbol

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString()
        This method reads from the console a String that should be validated by the parser
        Returns:
        the string read from the console

      • getMaxDepth

        public int getMaxDepth()
        This method asks for the maximum depth that the created tree must have. Then reads from the console for the user input
        Returns:
        an integer representing the maximum depth of the parsing tree
